translations.name: J.B. Phillips New Testament
translations.description: The Phillips New Testament in Modern English is an English translation of the New Testament of the Bible translated by Anglican clergyman J. B. Phillips. The project originally started as a sermon series for a youth group that met in bomb shelters during World War II. Phyllis published portions of his paraphrases in 1947, 1952, 1955, 1957, and 1958. His translations were compiled in 1961 and a second edition was published in 1972. Because of Phillips’ rephrasings, which were taken directly from the Greek, many editions of this translation were printed without verse numbers.
